meanings.definition: The action of tossing or throwing something.
meanings.sent1: He showed off his jactitation skills by throwing the ball far.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's jactitation of the discus impressed the crowd.
meanings.sent3: During the game, his jactitation of the ball made everyone cheer.
meanings.sent4: Her jactitation of the frisbee soared through the air like a bird.
meanings.sent5: The jactitation of the dice determined the winner of the game.

meanings.definition: Boastful or exaggerated speech or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His constant jactitation about his achievements annoyed his friends.
meanings.sent2: The politician's jactitation about his plans for the city was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent3: Her jactitation about her cooking skills made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The jactitation of the king's power echoed through the halls.
meanings.sent5: The jactitation of the pirate captain intimidated his crew into obedience.

meanings.definition: A restless tossing and turning in bed.
meanings.sent1: His jactitation in bed kept his roommate awake all night.
meanings.sent2: The baby's jactitation in the crib indicated she was not feeling well.
meanings.sent3: The cat's jactitation on the bed disrupted the peaceful night.
meanings.sent4: The jactitation of the storm outside matched his restless sleep.
meanings.sent5: The jactitation of the dog on the blanket made it hard to sleep.
